title: is largely concerned with syntactic features; for vocabulary
Two books by Michio Masui can also be consulted with profit: one a collection of essays, Studies in Chaucer's Language of Feeling
which deal with various aspects of Chaucer's style; and the other his The Structure of Chaucer's Rime Words: an Exploration into the Poetic Language of Chaucer
but frequently reprinted) remains valuable for showing how Chaucer exploited rhyme. For Chaucer's followers one may consult Norton-Smith
